data.title: Books Tell You Why, Inc
data.meta_description: Binding: Hardcover Book Condition: Fine in Fine dust jacket Edition: First Edition; First Printing Publisher: London: Weidenfeld & Nicholson, 1985. ISBN: 0297785915
data.text:
Now to My Mother: a Very Personal Memoir of Antonia White - 1st Edition/1st Printing

Susan Chitty, Harold Pinter

A handsome first edition/first printing in Fine condition in alike, price-clipped dustjacket. SIGNED by playwright Harold Pinter to his wife, Lady Antonia Fraser ("To A, Love H").

Based on long conversations with her mother and also on her mother's voluminous writings, Chitty's outspoken memoir of Antonia White is the first full account of the author of Frost in May (and three other novels. ) To her public Antonia was the gentle sensitive heroine of her stories; in real life she lived to be eighty and was never gentle. She was haunted by insanity and seemed a distant and frightening figure to her young daughters ; 8vo ; Signed by Author.

Price: $490.00 save 10% $441.00
